results.title: Roasted Sweet Potato, Broccoli and Chickpea Bowls

steps.step: For the veggies:Preheat the oven to 400F.
Add the red onion, sweet potatoes and broccoli to a large rimmed baking sheet.
Drizzle with the olive oil and sprinkle with the chili powder, salt and pepper. Toss to combine and spread in an even layer.
Bake for about 25 to 30 minutes, stirring once halfway through, until tender and starting to brown.

Remove from the oven and stir in the chickpeas. Season with additional salt / pepper to taste if needed. Maintain the oven temperature.For the pita chips:Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
Place the pita bread triangles on the baking sheet in a single layer. Mist with olive oil or nonstick cooking spray (or brush lightly with olive oil), then sprinkle with salt and pepper.

Bake for 5 minutes in the 400F oven, then flip the pita wedges over. Return to the oven and bake for an additional 4 to 5 minutes, until they are nice and crispy (keep an eye on them on the second side to be sure they dont burn!).For the sauce:While the chips are baking, add the tahini, lemon juice, maple syrup, cinnamon, salt and water to a small bowl.
Whisk until combined.

Add additional water if needed, a teaspoon or so at a time, to get the sauce to a consistency that you can drizzle.To serve:Scoop some of the veggie / chickpea mixture into a bowl. Top with a generous drizzle of the sauce and a sprinkle of almonds.
Serve with the pita chips!

ingredients.name: canned chickpeas
ingredients.original: 1 (15 ounce) can chickpeas, drained and rinsed
ingredients.originalString: 1 (15 ounce) can chickpeas, drained and rinsed

ingredients.name: sweet potatoes
ingredients.original: 2 medium-large sweet potatoes (about 1 ¾ pounds), cut into ½ inch chunks
ingredients.originalString: 2 medium-large sweet potatoes (about 1 ¾ pounds), cut into ½ inch chunks
ingredients.originalName: medium-large sweet potatoes (about , cut into ½ inch chunks

ingredients.name: water
ingredients.original: 2 ½ tablespoons water (or more as needed)
ingredients.originalString: 2 ½ tablespoons water (or more as needed)

ingredients.name: whole wheat pitas
ingredients.original: 3 large whole wheat pitas, cut into triangles
ingredients.originalString: 3 large whole wheat pitas, cut into triangles
ingredients.originalName: whole wheat pitas, cut into triangles

Add the red onion, sweet potatoes and broccoli to a large rimmed baking sheet.
Drizzle with the olive oil and sprinkle with the chili powder, salt and pepper. Toss to combine and spread in an even layer.

Serve with the pita chips!

steps.step: Put all the meat (flank steak through to bacon) into a large stock pot, cover with the water, and bring to a boil; remove all scum.

Add salt, peppercorns, onions, garlic, parsley (2 sprigs of fresh mint can be substituted if you wish), bay leaves and cloves; reduce the heat to medium-low, cover the pot, and simmer for about 90 minutes; test the sausages after about 40 minutes, however, and remove them (keep them warm) as soon as they're cooked.Test the remaining meat during the balance of the cooking time, as not all the meat may need the full 90 minutes of cooking time; keep meat warm when removing from the pot.Keep removing scum as mixture cooks, and skim off any visible fat as well.When all the meat has been removed, add the sweet potatoes, turnip, cabbage, carrots and the collard green (if the broth has reduced down too much, add water to ensure that the vegetables are covered); taste and add some salt if necessary.Over medium-low heat, cook the vegetables, covered, for about 20 minutes, or until they're tender when tested; if some vegetables cook faster than the others, remove them and keep warm.When all the veggies are cooked, cut both the meat and veggies into serving-size pieces and place on individual soup plates; drizzle broth over (you may not use it all), and serve.

ingredients.name: collard greens
ingredients.original: 1 collard greens, trimmed and cut roughly
ingredients.originalString: 1 collard greens, trimmed and cut roughly
ingredients.originalName: collard greens, trimmed and cut roughly

ingredients.original: 8 ounces lean bacon, in one piece
ingredients.originalString: 8 ounces lean bacon, in one piece

ingredients.original: 8 ounces pork hock, chopped in one-inch pieces
ingredients.originalString: 8 ounces pork hock, chopped in one-inch pieces

ingredients.original: 1 lb chourico sausage (the Portuguese equivalent to chorizo)

ingredients.originalName: chourico sausage (the Portuguese equivalent to chorizo)
